snippet: Israel has rejected the applications of Palestinian patients seeking treatment in Israel or the West Bank because they bear the logo “State of Palestine” rather than “Palestinian Authority.”
abstract: Israel rejects applications of Palestinian patients seeking treatment in Israel or the West Bank because paper bears logo 'State of Palestine' rather than 'Palestinian Authority'; Mahmoud Abbas, Palestinian president, ordered that the state logo be used on all official correspondence after he won status of nonmember observer state for Palestine at United Nations.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and FARES AKRAM
byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren reported from Jerusalem, and Fares Akram from Gaza City.

lead_paragraph: Israel has rejected the applications of Palestinian patients seeking treatment in Israel or the West Bank because they bear the logo “State of Palestine” rather than “Palestinian Authority.”

headline.main: Even a Stationery Logo Pits Palestinians Against Israel
headline.print_headline: Even a Logo Pits Palestinians Against Israel
